column4: i was wondering what could be wrong with my apache configuration (its default). here's wats up... before i had an index page, and i http'd my server it displayed the www directory's contents.... then i threw in an index.html..... and all went to hell... outcast-colony.com..... nothin happens

i was wondering what could be wrong with my apache configuration (its default). here's wats up... before i had an index page, and i http'd my server it displayed the www directory's contents.... then i threw in an index.html..... and all went to hell... outcast-colony.com..... nothin happens
Without an index page, listing is normal
Is your index readable by www-data?
Is it really a html file? or is it a php file?  What have you changed in the config?
the config file is the default
how u delete a file again?
with a text file, its fine
And thoes are showing up in the log?  (are we sure we're hitting the right machine?)
